intro: Potentilla micrantha subsp. carniolica, commonly known as the Carpathian cinquefoil, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender stems and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant produces small, five-lobed leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
